Class MoveHandler

java.lang.Object
  ch.i10a.reversi.gameplay.MoveHandler

public class MoveHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Handler for performing and checking possible Moves.

Method Detail

registerFields

public static void registerFields(Field[][] fields)
Registers the fields of the board for later access.

doMove

public static java.util.ArrayList<Field> doMove(Field activeField)
Performs the move on the active field. This method runs synchronized to avoid side-effects.

Parameters:
activeField - the field on which the move is being performed.
Returns:
ArrayList of fields that are beaten with the move that was done

checkIfNextPlayerIsPossibleToMove

public static void checkIfNextPlayerIsPossibleToMove()
This method determines if a player can move. If he can, it collects the possible field hits. But if he can't the pass method is hit and it is checked if the following player can't move too. If both cannot move, the game is over (implemented in setDoublePass, which sets the flag for it)

isAnimating

public static boolean isAnimating()
this method checks if a field on the board is still animating

Returns:
boolean, if the whole animation is complete

hitEnemyStones

public static java.util.ArrayList<Field> hitEnemyStones(Field field,
                                                        PlayerI player)
Representation of hitEnemyStones with two parameters, which is necessary for the not simulated hitEnemyStones method

Parameters:
the - field where the stone was played, the active Player via Interface PlayerI
Returns:
ArrayList of Fields which stones are beaten

hitEnemyStones

public static java.util.ArrayList<Field> hitEnemyStones(Field field,
                                                        PlayerI player,
                                                        boolean simulate)
Returns an ArrayList of Fields, which represents the beaten stones in all directions. Also updates the fields with the correspondent value. if only computing (simulation), the direct value is set. if the hits are done for real, the doubled value is set for animation set up

Parameters:
the - field where the stone was played, the active Player via Interface PlayerI, the boolean simulate for computing or realtime animation
Returns:
ArrayList of Fields which stones are beaten

collectingPossibleFieldHits

public static void collectingPossibleFieldHits()
Runs through the board and collects the possible fields to hit for every field.

checkWholeFieldHit

public static boolean checkWholeFieldHit()
Returns true, if the actual Player can hit stones on the whole field, else it returns false

Returns:
Boolean that's true, if the actual player can beat at least one stone

checkHit

public static boolean checkHit(Field field,
                               PlayerI player)
Returns true if hit(s) are possible Example (a is the active field, r is the place the enemy is, i is where your stone is): |-----|-----|-----|-----| | a | | | | |-----|-----|-----|-----| | | r | | | |-----|-----|-----|-----| | | | r | | |-----|-----|-----|-----| | | | | i | |-----|-----|-----|-----|

Returns:
false if no stones can be hitten

checkNeighbourEnemies

public static boolean checkNeighbourEnemies(Field field,
                                            PlayerI player)
Returns true if a neighbour is an enemy. Example (a is the active field, r is any place an enemy could be on): |-----|-----|-----| | r | r | r | |-----|-----|-----| | r | a | r | |-----|-----|-----| | r | r | r | |-----|-----|-----|

Returns:
false no neighbour is an enemy

checkForFreeFields

public static boolean checkForFreeFields()
Checks if a free field is available on the board. if not, the game is over.

Returns:
true if a free field is available, false if not

getRandomMove

public static Field getRandomMove()
gives back a field that is played by the computer. for the easiest difficulty, this is a random field out of the playable ones

Returns:
Field that is played randomly

getBestMove

public static Field getBestMove(boolean strengthHard)
this method is the starting point for calculation of difficulty medium and hard. The difficulty can be switched from medium to hard by seeting strengthHard to true. the best move is then calculated by alpha-beta algorithm. If the game is in the end phase, the depth of the alpha-beta calculation is altered to ten as we have enough memory then.

Parameters:
boolean - strengthHard determines the heuristic calculated
Returns:
Field that is played, determined by the alpha-beta algorithm

alphaBeta

public static int alphaBeta(int alpha,
                            int beta,
                            int depth,
                            PlayerAdapter player,
                            TreeNode<Board> node,
                            boolean strengthHard)
the recursive heart of the program. if the depth is 0, we reached a leaf and can calculate the value for the situation with the heuristic (which heuristic to take is determined by the boolean strengthHard). if we are not in the leaf, the algorithm calculates minimums and maximums for the players and even cuts out unnecessary moves, thus saving memory

Parameters:
alpha - is the value for the alpha cut, beta is the int value for the beta cut
PlayerAdapter - Interface is needed to determine the player in charge for this move
TreeNode - node is the played situation from the node above and the new field value to play along
boolean - strengthHard determines the heuristic calculated
Returns:
integer value that shows how good the prognose is for the played move

updateSimBoard

public static Board updateSimBoard(Board board,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<Field> fields)
This method updates the simBoard with the given fields

Parameters:
board - is the board to do the update to
fields - is an Arraylist of Fields to get the update values
Returns:
the updated board

getPossibleFields

public static java.util.List<Field> getPossibleFields(PlayerI player)
gets the possible fields to play on. determined by: if a field is played and it hits other stones, it's good to play but only if it is empty

Parameters:
PlayerI - player Interface for determining of which player is on
Returns:
a List of Fields that can be played by the respective player

printBoard

public static void printBoard(Board board,
                              PlayerI player)
prints out the board situation, if the program is running in debug mode
